snippet: Although income dropped in the last fiscal year, the auto maker said a new model lineup would help it further boost profit to $21.5 billion in the year through March 2013.
abstract: Toyota Motor reports net income for the fiscal year through March was 283.6 billion yen ($3.6 billion), down 31 percent from a year earlier; says a new model lineup will help its profit more than double to 760 billion yen($9.5 billion) in the current year through March 2013. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: TOKYO -- Toyota Motor reported another step in its uneven road to recovery Wednesday, saying that income for the fiscal year that ended in March had tumbled, but that it expected profit for the current year to more than double to

headline.main: Toyota Slips, But Predicts A Doubling Of Profits
